Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: antiques9
Reviews.Content: We always love our stay at the Lenox! The staff is outstanding, we are greeted as family, everyone know our name. Great location. Near wonderful shops, the Musee d'Orsay, and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Boogie10
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay at the Lenox. Still a great hotel & ideally located in Paris to see all the main sites & attractions. Easy to get to via the metro from Gard de Nord. Breakfast is european style and lots to choose from, fresh fruit, pastries, cheeses, meats & gorgeous crossiants. Would recommend the hop on & off buses for getting around the city & a Segway tour with Logic Way is a must, really good fun and a great way to get around & rest your feet!

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the Spring”
Reviews.Author: alejeune
Reviews.Content: Great visit to paris - Hotel Lenox is pretty central to get to the Louvre, Tuilleries , Eiffel Tower and all the bars and restaurants in St G-des-Prés. Straight run on the metro from Gare du Nord to St Germain, then a 5 minute wander to the hotel - v straightforward Nice hotel with good (paris size) rooms - all friendlyand helpful staff who don't intrude but very pleased to help when they are asked - and will tolerate mangled french as well as english (and probably a few other languages!) Will go there and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Peter G
Reviews.Content: Just took a wonderful long weekend in Paris and very glad I booked the Hotel Lenox (through Eurostar.com). The location was basically perfect, a stones throw from the Musee D'Orsay, close to the St Germain metro and you can walk just about anywhere in town. We got a deal on a deluxe room which was comfortable, clean and well presented. A little on the small side but that's Paris I guess. Staff were friendly and helpful, the inclusive breakfast was good, although we were so stuffed from the perviosu nights dining we couldn't take full advantage. Nice bar area too, and a welcome drink.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: no m
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Paris was fabulous thanks to the Lenox Hotel in Saint Germain! Everything was perfect. The staff was very welcoming, nice and helpful. The rooms are clean, with lovely furniture that creates a peaceful and romantic atmosphere. The location is unique, in Saint Germain area, definitely the place to be in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the best location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NReno21
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Lenox, and its 'sister' hotels are wonderful. The service and staff are welcoming, very helpful and always considerate. The rooms are warm, quiet, and nicely appointed. The public room bar, lobby, are very nice. A very very good hotel. It is so nice to have a good hotel in Paris, in a perfect location. The Hotel Lenox is it!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret n Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Hal566
Reviews.Content: Clean and inviting. Wonderful staff, cozy bar, superb location. Have stayed at the Lenox for years and always enjoy coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Best location with unparalleled service”
Reviews.Author: sbeerling
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at Hotel Lenox for over the past decade. The staff is gracious and welcoming. They have assisted with reservations and taxis. We even received an unsolicited room upgrade for no additional cost. The rooms are warm and quiet. This is really a superlative deal given the location, quiet and level of service. I look forward to staying at Hotel Lenox again next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The stay was ruined by the check out.”
Reviews.Author: annadash
Reviews.Content: We booked our first stay in Paris through Eurostar and got a good rate for a deluxe room. We had a nice welcome on arrival at Hotel Lenox and the lobby area was good space. We had booked for three nights and this was confirmed on our arrival so as it was our first trip to Paris we asked how much it would cost to upgrade to the junior suite for the duration of our stay. We were quoted 130 euro which was basically the difference between the two anyway. We decided that we would do it and make the stay extra special. The junior suite was over two floors but was very tiny. The bathroom had an unpleasant smell of a urinal that seemed to come from the shower drain not really condusive to getting ready to go out. The bedroom in the suite was up the stairs and perfectly adequate albeit a bit tired looking. We had breakfast included in our deal and would not have bothered if it had not been included. The chap that served the breakfast was very friendly so we could not fault the service but cold croissants are not the same as nice warm ones. So three days later, taxi ordered and all packed we went down to reception to check out. We waited for ten minutes for the receptionist to grace us with his presence. The taxi had arrived and the cases were loaded and the meter was now running. This was when they tried to charge us for the breakfasts but we had the email confirmation from Eurostar with us and were able to prove that it was included. Then they hit us with a bill for 390 euro for the room upgrade! This was beyond belief as the difference between the room rate for the deluxe room that we had already paid for and a junior suite was 50 euro a night on the maximum rate. The receptionist told us the 130 euro was per night and not as we had agreed for the duration of our stay. No one in their right mind would have agreed to pay 90 euro a night over the room rate. The exchange became really heated with the receptionist and it was very upsetting. We stuck to our guns and paid the agreed 130 euro but my husband was called every profanity going as we left. The taxi meter had already reached 17.50 euro before we even left the hotel! This experience really ruined the Paris experience for us and we will never return to the Hotel Lenox. The best advise I can give you is if you want to stay at this hotel and upgrade get the agreed amount printed out and signed for your protection.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Christine M
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times now, and this latest time the service, as ever, was wonderful. I had a problem with my flight back to Australia the next day, and the concierge went to endless trouble to help me resolve it. The service is one reason why I return. But there are other reasons as well: the rooms, though small, are charming and comfortable, and always immaculate, and the bathrooms modern and larger than usual in Paris. I love the location, and always feel at home in what is my favourite part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: Patricia G
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Paris in a few years, and I was recommended hotel Lenox by a friend. It is in a great location on the Left Bank. Although the room I stayed in was small, the service and attention to detail made this only a minor inconvenience - for I have stayed in larger rooms in hotels where there has been no personal attention. First of all the breakfast room is charming and beautifully detailed with marquetry panelling of jazz musicians and themes from the '20s. I requested a soft boiled egg on the first morning and was asked in great detail exactly the degree of 'soft boiled' I desired - it was determined that it would be a four minute egg. It was perfection. The concierge recommended a favorite local restaurant of his to me which was excellent. On my last morning I had an early flight and had to leave the Hotel at 6:00AM before the restaurant was open. When I arrived in the lobby, Antonin, the concierge who had been on night duty had a tray prepared for me with steaming coffee, fresh squeezed orange juice and a Madeleine. No amount of star ratings in front of a Hotel's name can guarantee that the staff will really care, and no amount of money can buy the care that was given to me on my stay at the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: c p
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Paris, so we had nothing to compare it to. We thought the Hotel Lenox was nice and what we expected. The staff was friendly and helpful when needed. The area was perfect, walking distance to the Louvre, The Orsay and many other wonderful things. Our only complaint was that it seemed as though the room had not been entered in a while. There were dead flowers on the table upon entering. The Patio was full of dead plants in the summer time, a little disappointing. Overall, we were there to see Paris not a hotel room, so those minor mishaps can be overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of in room refreshments brings this rating down”
Reviews.Author: Pakistandy
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Lenox is definitely its location, ideally placed as it is between the Seine and St. Germain. We found our room to be quite an acceptable size even compared to the large rooms we're used to in Asian hotels. The staff at the hotel were helpful but a couple of things really marked the hotel down in my estimation. We visited the hotel in December and the weather outside was cold. I was suprised to find no in-room coffee or tea facilities upon arrival, something I would expect from even fairly cheap hotels. When I asked on the second day if we could order a hot drink in our room, or take one up from the bar, I was informed that all drinks had to be taken downstairs. The second matter occurred during check out. I had paid in advance for the room and yet was asked to pay a further amount upon check out. I pointed out that I had paid in advance to secure the price of the room to be told that the rates had changed since I booked. I was insistent about the terms of my booking and so the staff member on duty checked the records to discover that, as our stay had been over a weekend, two of the nights were cheaper than shown on the computer. Not the sort of mistake that should be being made. There's plenty of choice in the area and I'd probably look elsewhere on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lenox Saint Germain”
Reviews.Author: Daniel J
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, clean, affordable and friendly. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly excellent”
Reviews.Author: 100Honkers
Reviews.Content: I had originally chosen a hotel in Montparnasse based on a friends recommendation. I stumbled upon this one by accident and chose it because it was closer to what I wanted to see. I wanted to explore the tourist center of Paris with minimum transport, maximizing walking. The hotel's location is awesome, in a great area (though pricey for food) with stunning shops - judging from the windows. The hotel is great. Spotlessly clean, the breakfast buffet is filling, featured fresh juice, a variety of breads, cheeses, cold cuts, fruit, cereal. The hotel is small, but has a fully staffed front desk. The people were friendly and helpful. Our room (the cheapest the have) was small but adequate. The bathroom was nice and big. Obviously there is street noise, since this is the middle of Paris but the hotel was quiet and the beds were very comfortable. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. My trip was as a tourist to explore the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but a little tired.”
Reviews.Author: Islander_66_10
Reviews.Content: I read several of the other reviews and wondered if I stayed in the same hotel.  I've been to Paris 7-8 times and have a pretty good idea of the standard. I stayed at the Lenox last spring for a week and found the hotel to be ok, but our room was a little rough around the edges; peeling and chipped paint, torn draperies, unlevel bed, etc. The location is quiet and the staff was helpful but I found the neighborhood to be a little too residential - just a personal preference. I found the bar to be pretty dull as well. I don’t recall seeing more than 3-4 people in there at any one time. Overall, not bad, but I would probably go elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, great location, quaint”
Reviews.Author: HHReiser
Reviews.Content: We just spent a weekend visiting Paris and were not disappointed in our choice of hotel. Lenox ist well located: by foot to the Louvre and Notre Dame and the great Saint Germain area and close to a couple Metro lines. The rooms are small (we even crammed an extra bed in for our daughter), but give you the feeling that you are really in Paris! Denis was a big help at the front desk and even told us about a special art gallery event that was that afternoon in the neighborhood. Make sure you get directions to the lively bar/restaurant area -- particularly beautiful now with the Christmas lights! Breakfast (additional) offers a nice buffet and other options. I unfortunately was very sick the night before we left, but they were very understanding and offered us the room until we had to leave for our flight in the early afternoon -- averting what could have been a horrible end to the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: co-lab54
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Lenox on a business trip recently and was extremely impressed with the combination of charm, location and ambiance. The staff were friendly and attentive, the rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable and the location perfect. This will now be my hotel of choice for visits of business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Denis”
Reviews.Author: amy0718
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Lenox and recommend it. The location is fantastic and the bar area especially nice. The service at breakfast and in the evening was simply outstanding. The rooms and elevator are very small. Be sure you ask for Denis. He is simply the best with a wonderful attitude. The other front desk person.....not so much. Overall, good value. Oh, make sure you order transportation to airport WELL in advance. Our driver was an hour late picking us up.

Reviews.Title: “Returned, very cooperative, friendly and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Killara69
Reviews.Content: More than lived up to all expectations, as usual a great place from which to 'walk' Paris. Helpful welcoming staff and cosy, comfortable room, great bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keith R
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth stay at the Hotel Lenox, but it had been a few years since our last visit and that can be a long time for Paris, in that a lot can change. We found, to our delight, that it continues to be an excellent choice. Location cannot be better and the staff is very, very helpful. They got us Restaurant reservations that were, as they say, difficult, and provided all of the advice that we needed. I would recommend this Hotel to all that travel to our beloved Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: mjelling84
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lenox is in a perfect location, it's very clean, quintessentially Parisian, and very reasonably priced. We could not have been happier with our choice and will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Paris Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tvanunen
Reviews.Content: 2 of my friends recommended Hotel Lenox to me based on their previous positive experiences with this hotel. I am sure glad I took their advice! I absolutely loved this charming hotel and exceptional service. The hotel is within walking distance to all the great restaurants in Saint Germain, as well as Le Louvre and other key sites. The rooms were beautifully decorated and have a lot of character. (So much better than staying in a generic hotel-chain guest room!) To top it all off, the service was fantastic. I must make specific mention of 'Denis' at the front desk. Denis was the perfect host, and his recommendations for restaurants, sites, directions etc. were always spot-on. Thanks to Denis, I was able to maximize my time in Paris and enjoy real 'Parisian' cuisine and ambiance as opposed to the typical tourist traps. Thank you Denis! :-) I will definitely stay at Hotel Lenox when I return to Paris. C'est formidable! - Tara

Reviews.Title: “Great celebration”
Reviews.Author: Nicola B
Reviews.Content: I organised the golden anniverary of my parents wedding in Paris in May this year. Hotel Lennox had been very helpful to find the shows, driver and restaurants in Paris. This Hotel is very welcoming and has cosy and well decorated rooms and the location is perfect to explore Paris. We all would recommend Hotel Lenox for a stay in Paris. I will come back N Borkmann

Reviews.Title: “One Big Shrug”
Reviews.Author: pennytravelling
Reviews.Content: Location - Fantastic. Room - Small & clean, if a little worn. Bathroom - Decent with lovely soaps. Attitude - Atrocious. It's Paris - I get it. But, really? The "night manager" was utterly disinterested. When we first entered our room, I wanted to adjust the temperature but the fixture had been ripped from the wall. We wanted to see what the weather would be like for the next day's adventures. The tv remote was missing. My husband called the front desk to let them know, but was met with the response that "it has to wait until tomorrow - There's nothing I can do." It was only 9pm & blazingly hot. The morning manager shrugged too, but told us that all would be fixed that day. After a good day out & about, we returned that afternoon to see the night manager was back again, and nothing had been fixed in our room. He did not believe that anything was amiss. We finally convinced him to come up to the now scalding hot 5th floor room, & he accused us of taking the tv remote & the temperature controls. Then he told us that if we wanted remotes, we would need to pilfer them from another room. And then he said not to tell anyone... Then he shrugged & walked away... I hope that the renovations went well & that the historic bar is open again, which was the reason we chose the place (July 2010). I also hope to stay somewhere else next time. I expected a small, but clean & confortable room. I even expected a bit of snootiness. But they actually managed to fulfill every stereotype of Parisian attitude that I could have imagined & more... Bummer.

Reviews.Title: “It's French...”
Reviews.Author: jammiee
Reviews.Content: Beautiful little hotel on the left bank in a great location...the room was perfect..cozy clean and everything you'd need..there was one guy who worked at the desk who made everything easy, Dennis...tell him Hermes sent you...he'll know what you mean ;-)

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Wendy L
Reviews.Content: My first time in Paris, my husband and I stayed at the Lenox and loved it! We expected small rooms but we were luckily upgraded to a suite. We had a cute little terrace and a skylight. The staff at reception were great, booking our hotel shuttle and making fabulous restaurant suggestions! Comfortable bed, clean and modern bathroom. I loved the charm and elegance of this hotel. Walking distance to everything and the greatest little chocolate place around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Mendo2CA
Reviews.Content: We just had our third stay at Hotel Lenox. It is a nice hotel in a good location. The deluxe rooms are small but clean. Don't expect an American-size room. Decor is nice. The staff are generally friendly and helpful. On a couple of occasions individuals at the front desk have not been that friendly or helpful. Breakfast is fine and reasonable enough for Paris. We would most likely stay there again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lenox Saint Germain”
Reviews.Author: rodney C
Reviews.Content: Ater extensive refurbishment this is once again a great place to stay.Good rooms,excellant management,charming and helpful staff-especially on reception and a good position in St Germain.Highly recommended.Rodney Capstick-Dale

Reviews.Title: “Good luck”
Reviews.Author: Glenrad
Reviews.Content: I wonder if the people writing the positive reviews have ever stayed at a nice hotel or perhaps they work for the Lenox. We arrived for a 4 night stay in September. It was very warm and it was the only hotel in the area that had its doors wide open, making it impossible to sit in the lobby or the bar. The temperature was 90 degrees. It stayed this way for the entire stay. The room was barely big enough to fit the bed, and there was not one drawer in the entire room so we lived out of our luggage, which there was no room for. It was difficult to shower without flooding the room. There was no mirror other than the one in the bathroom. The hairdryer fell off the wall, as did the cup holder. The carpet was filthy, as was the coverlet, and on the 2nd day they tried turning off the a/c in the entire building. I had to raise a stink to get it back on. I have never in my life complained about a room and I have travelled extensively. The front desk varied from helpful to indifferent. The management here gives the appearance of trying to save every penny. We asked for a dinner reservation and when we never heard back the front desk said they were too busy to get back to us. The only good thing about this place is its location, and the great restaurant around the corner, Le Perron. I have never been compelled to write a review, so here is my first.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MickyDionisio
Reviews.Content: Nothing to write home about in terms of the room class or service. Our major complaint about the room was the air conditioner simply did not work. The air would kick on but very little ir would come out of the vent. Luckily when we went in May the weather was quite cool so it didn't bug us much. On the bright side, the hotel's location is great. A few minutes walk and you're at the river. You can get to the Louvre in two blocks. Travel the opposite way and you're walking down the very trendy Rue Saint-Germain full of cafes, designer shops. Lot's of great things to do on this beautiful street. Quick tip - There's a small mom and pop grocery store right around the corner from here. Get 2 liter water bottles for 50c. Stock up ;) All in all, you won't be grossly disappointed and want to check out right away but you also won't be wow'd.

Reviews.Title: “The location is unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: Hugosdaughter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is sweet, small-to-the-point-of-too-small-for-comfort, and somewhat miserly in its amenities. Really - 300+ euros a night and the towels were old, grey and hard? Not such a small quibble, I thought. And not much evidence of housekeeping, in terms of things like putting on the a/c in advance of our occupancy (despite a heatwave...), or turn down...Our room was an attic duplex, with a small, scaled-for-my-4'11"-proportions sitting area and then stairs up to the bed. Not TOO tiny a bathroom (compared to the Montalemert where we stayed last year). But it must be pretty uncomfortable if you're a regular-sized person! It's pretty and quiet, and next time we'll ask for a corner room on a lower floor - still small but more airy and lighter. But we will stay here again, happily, because of where it is. The same owner apparently owns all three hotels on that corner, and some of the rooms in the St Vincent are supposed to be a little larger than in the Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no complaints, I'll be a repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: Margaret C
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location on the west bank, within easy walking distance of the Seine, St Germain, and the across the river, the Louvre and the attractions of Rue St Honore and surrounds. The staff were helpful, and as a lone traveller, I enjoyed the friendly and easy atmosphere. My room was a good size for Paris, and very comfortable. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: MickyDionisio
Reviews.Content: Nothing to write home about in terms of the room class or service. Our major complaint about the room was the air conditioner simply did not work. The air would kick on but very little ir would come out of the vent. Luckily when we went in May the weather was quite cool so it didn't bug us much. On the bright side, the hotel's location is great. A few minutes walk and you're at the river. You can get to the Louvre in two blocks. Travel the opposite way and you're walking down the very trendy Rue Saint-Germain full of cafes, designer shops. Lot's of great things to do on this beautiful street. Quick tip - There's a small mom and pop grocery store right around the corner from here. Get 2 liter water bottles for 50c. Stock up ;) All in all, you won't be grossly disappointed and want to check out right away but you also won't be wow'd.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this gem of a hotel and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Anne d
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an undeniable charm and is in one of the best locations in Paris if you like to walk everywhere! The rooms are small and simple, but cosy and comfortable. The breakfast is abundant and delicious and very French, just the way we like it. I would recommend this for anyone wanting a small private get away that is not too expensive and too over the top. The front desk personnel could not be more helpful or engaging! Anne from NY

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike K
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Lenox Saint Germain was very nice. We would stay there again. Denis, the concierge was very helpful and friendly. He was very helpful in answering all of our questions about the hotel and the city. Many people complain about leaving the key with the front desk....I found that it was a smart and convenient thing to do....we never had to wait to get the key when we came back ....furthermore, we didn't have to worry about losing it in the city. The room was small but charming and had 2 large windows that opened on to the street...the hotel is located on a quite residential street within a short walking distance to a street market, grocery market, lots of eateries, the L'ouvre, the metro train, the Seine River, and so much more.....the hotel doesn't offer wash clothes so if you must have one, bring your own...also the bathroom was large but the shower was a little awkward as the shower door only reaches half the shower which creates a watery mess on the bathroom floor.....that was really the only negative about this property.....and the fact that I wish there was more storage in the room...the bedside tables were 2 cube tables, they could have used something with drawers to give more storage. All in all, I would definitely come back.....it was clean and the decor was very attractive and the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Debbie and Bill U
Reviews.Content: Great service but a typically small European room. So close to many attractions in a quiet and safe area. Lots of restaurants, shops and attractions all within an easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bizzztraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while in Paris on business. The hotel was centrally located within walking distance of many restaurants and shops. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and Value!”
Reviews.Author: MarkTFS
Reviews.Content: Stylish, clean, and well-located. The Lenox is always a consideration for me, whether I'm alone or with my child. Rooms and bathrooms are clean and updated and the hotel has wifi internet access. One of the few Paris hotels that I've found where you can take two adjacent rooms that create a 2-bedroom affordable suite due to a lockable hallway alcove door. Brilliant! The hotel is quiet. The hotel staff are courteous and helpful. I love the location, being situated less than a 5 minute walk from the Seine, directly across from the Louvre. It's also situated at one of the better entry points to the Saint Germain shopping area, a part of Paris that's open late and safe for a late night walk.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it, making it our place to stay when in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: MaryPortsmouthRIUSA
Reviews.Content: We went to paris for a few days in February for my birthday. Usually we stay at the Lenox montparnasse, but we wanted to try a different neighborhood for a change. The location is excellent, the staff very accommodating (they charged our flip video camera on their computer), helped us with directions and restaurant recommendations, and were super nice. Denis told us about the new Hermes store that is a must see. It's a cozy boutique hotel, very charming. The bar/breakfast room is beautifully decorated with inlayed wood depictions of Louis Armstrong, with art deco lamps etc. I would highly recommend this hotel, and st germain, a wonderful neighborhood with many shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God my company paid, not me!”
Reviews.Author: TheDon045
Reviews.Content: My room was incredibly small with a view of a dirty little courtyard. The breakfast was distinctly average, as was the service. If you're not paying then it'll do but think twice before parting with your own cash!

Reviews.Title: “Dingy”
Reviews.Author: JB1900
Reviews.Content: The staff barely looked up when asked a question and seemed bothered to answer anything. Location is good, but the rooms are very small and seedy.

Reviews.Title: “Less value for the money”
Reviews.Author: nasavin
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with clients. The rooms are astonishingly cramped. I am not sure whether this is the case for other hotels in the locality but felt very inconvenient. I didnt had space even to acomodate my luggage which is just onesize bigger than the usual cabin size bag and it blocked my way to the bathroom from room. Hotel website claims its a 3 star but it hard to accept. The service was not so great. Found the room was not getting locked and when complained the receptionist was rudely asking whether i did some damage to the lock. The good thing about the hotel is its location. So Nice and serene and close to all good things of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique hotel with bags of charm”
Reviews.Author: PaulymLondon
Reviews.Content: If you're not familiar with hotels in Paris you may think the rooms are small, but we have found this typical of all the hotels we have stayed in. The reception and bar area is cosy and well worth a cocktail before indulging in one of the many restaurants near by. Staff at reception are friendly and efficient. The rooms are not the height of luxury but they are clean and have everything you need for a city break, and we really loved the individual character of the rooms which is so often lacking in modern hotels. A great base to explore Paris. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Cest73
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Lenox and found it to be a very comfortable and nice hotel. It is in a wonderful location surrounded by gorgeous shops, cafes and restaurants and within walking distance to two metro stations. We stayed in a deluxe room and whilst it was small, it had everything we needed. The bed was great, it was quiet (except for the occassional noise of guests entering their rooms from the hallway), clean and decent bathroom. It is not luxurious but it is a very good standard of accommodation (I would describe it as elegant and charming) and reasonably priced for the area. The staff were all extremely friendly whilst somewhat lacking in information but nonetheless helpful. The bar downstairs is a really lovely spot to sit and have a drink in the evenings after a busy day in Paris - it has an almost clubbish feel to it and I loved the cocktails!

Reviews.Title: “The best of Paris within walking distence!”
Reviews.Author: CHStockholm
Reviews.Content: The hotell-service is excellent and as a often guest in Paris its with great pleasure I return to this hotel. This is the spot to start your Paris trip eather as a turist,looking for shopping/culture as for drink and dining,or for buiness,looking for time to save but still cover the best of Paris. C.H from Stockholm.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Eh... Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abuda
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is perfect.. Very close and walkable to all sites.. Really close to St. Germain, but on a quiet street. The room was small, but managable... We stayed in a DELUXE room, the first room on 5th floor was with 2 floors, very dark cramped room, and an upstairs bathroom (which was very nice). We didi not like the room at all, so we requested another room, and the reception was very helpful about it. Our second Deloxe room on 3rd level, was OK, with big windows and little bit larger. Still it was a small room, small bathroom, but very manageble. The building is old, so I think thats why the floors are tilted. Really weird feeling when you get in the room or walk on the corridor. The room was clean, but definately not refurbished as stated on their website. Dark and oldish carpet and curtains..The bathroom was ok, but the finishes and tiles were dingy. The hair dfryer was a nightmare, vacuum tube looking weird old model dryer that kept falling apart.. The bath towels were torn.. The bed and pillow were very very comfortable, and the room was very quiet, no street noise, etc, so we slept really well. The room service was not good at all, everyday they forgot something, one day the did not replace the towels, one day the toilet paper, and next day they forgot to put on the pillow covers !!! The guy - Dennis at the reception was great, very helpful with everything.. The free wi-fi did not work for us- we never got a connection, and the free computer in the lobby broke down after 2 days, but Dennis offered us his computer at the reception.. Overall, the hotel is OK.. Location is SUPERB... Just make sure that you confirm the room style you are staying at before you arrive, photos on their website are misleading in my opinion..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is conveniently located to see the sights.”
Reviews.Author: Fin_9
Reviews.Content: Good location and staff very helpful - in particular Denis who was very charming and friendly as well as good at his job. Found the first room much too small and had to upgrade which was more expense. 3 rates for breakfast - we went for the middle rate [ Continental - 11 euros} It would have been handy to have kettle in room. Would visit again if could get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby rooms”
Reviews.Author: alium
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the photos on this website, or the fact it says the rooms have been refurbished. It may simply be a problem with translation but the rooms were redecorated in 2010, not refurbished, and the paintwork and fittings are wearing very badly. The owner has 77 bedrooms (in 3 hotels) but does not employ any maintenance staff. We found bedside lights hanging off the wall, very scuffed paintwork, wrinkled wallpaper behind the loo (damp, obviously) and a general feelling of scruffiness. The bathrooms are pretty awful - ours had the basin fixed to the pedestal with a bit of wire, a shower head set so low it was only good for half-washing the body, grotty tiling and grouting. I would say they were about 10 years old, certainly not refurbished recently. The downstairs lobby is very nice and the reception staff could not have been more helpful but we did not enjoy our stay and were very disappointed that it didn't live up to its website promise.

Reviews.Title: “Good quiet location, excellent helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: civic92
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights as a base for a restful return trip to Paris. The hotel was easy to find close to St Germaine metro and short walk to River Seine and D'orsay museum. Delightful breakfast in cosy lounge area each morning. Classic room was a little small for two but very clean and comfortable. Bathroom was great. Staff excelled in making our stay enjoyable and actively participated in providing information and conversation to help us. Would definitely return when we next visit Paris. Glenn & Nora Australia

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: drhs72
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel at the recommendation of a colleague in New York: he has been coming here for years. It was a perfect location, just a walk from many museums ( Musee D'Orsay, the Louvre, great restaurants and cafes (Cafe Flore, Au 35 rue Jacob) and le Bon Marche department store... yet quiet and secluded. The front lobby and bar area is tasteful and attractive. The room was clean and well decorated, promptly and cheerfully rejuvenated each day. Most importantly the staff were always very helpful and interesting people - helped us with find a restaurant on a rainy night, a travel route to CDG, and fixing the wireless on our laptop. We hope to return the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: otef
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for a minibreak to Paris. Located on a quiet street in the 5th arrondissement it is just a 5'-10' walk from the Saint Germain de Pres metro station, the Louvre, the Orsay Museum, the Latin Quarter, the Banks of the Seine river and the Notre Dame. All around one can find many nice bistrots, cafes and bars in a very intellectual and romantic neighborhood. The room was trendy, clean, cozy, although a bit too hot even for winter. The Wi-Fi in the room is a plus. Denis stood out from the rest of the hotel receptionists as being very polite, helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel, if you want to get a real taste of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashley872011
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Leonx for 2 nights whilst on business in Paris and found it a comfortable and convenient place to stay. The staff were very helpful and the hotel was in a good location for getting around Paris. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “so stylish yet so affordable. merci denis!”
Reviews.Author: suprhan
Reviews.Content: found the hotel lenox via travel + leisure...in an article on paris marc jacobs stated it as a favorite. travelling with my best friend via eurostar from london, we found this hotel absolutely perfect for our quick minibreak to paris (my first french holiday.) our front desk attendant denis was so kind and helpful, even stopping to greet us on his off hours with a genuine smile and hello as we dined at the nearby cafe de flore. hotel and staff were charming and stylish! several friends are staying there this summer on our recommendation. merci beaucoup!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: PerryRZ
Reviews.Content: Great place for a romantic weekend in Paris. Location is very good and the service friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great experience at Hotel Lenox!”
Reviews.Author: TINIfoodbar
Reviews.Content: Denis was a very polite and helpful concierge. He was very attentive and knowledgeable and went above and beyond to be sure that we had good information and help navigating Paris. They upgraded our hotel room without us asking. The room was clean with a large bed, closet and bathroom. Breakfast was delicious and the bar/lounge was very hip. Over-all a great experience! Thanks Denis!

Reviews.Title: “splendid”
Reviews.Author: parisbuff83
Reviews.Content: Perfect locus, quiet and convenient, for all classic paris life.A lovely little cafe bar in the lobby. Just great and really helpful staff. My wife and I had a most pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a GREAT Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 60713Susan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at the Hotel Lenox for 10 years now. We usually visit Paris in January and have found this to be a wonderful location with great service, fabulous rooms and a new and improved lobby. The decor in the Bar remains the same which is and always has been most enjoyable. I recommend this hotel highly and would not visit Paris without staying at Hotel Lenox Saint Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well-located”
Reviews.Author: alain028
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel located a block away from Boul. St-Germain-des-Pres, within walking distance to numerous cafes, restaurants, shops, etc. The service is very friendly, and although is it close to bustling areas, the environment is surprisingly quiet and conducive to a good night of sleep. Although a tad small (after all, this is Paris), the room was nicely arranged and clean. Free wireless internet access is provided, which is a very nice feature. My only criticism would be the breakfast (which is not included in the price of the room, so it's not really an issue); you can do better for less at a nearby cafe. Overall, I was very satisfied and I absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great personal hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: mbanfield
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Lenox many times and have enjoyed it's charm always! Hotel Lenox has a wonderful ambience and a personal feel. The staff are great, they add to the feel of the place with their attention to detail and helpful approach. The rooms are not huge but each has a unique charm. They are decorated in beautiful traditional French style and are always clean and comfortable. Many rooms have windows looking out onto the street which gives you the real Paris feeling, you can almost think you are in your own Paris apartment. The location is then what sets this hotel apart. It is perhaps the best location in paris. You can walk to so many wonderful places which is a huge benefit, the the St germain area is a dream, wonderul ambience and atmosphere. All in all a great find. Its a great little place. Mark

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 1tea1coffee
Reviews.Content: We spent a very pleasant post Christmas short break here. Lovely room with very spacious bathroom. Quiet street. Friendly, helpful staff. Lovely bar to relax in. Excellent area - superb cafes and restaurants within walking distance and very easy to walk to tourist attractions - the Louvre, Notre Dame etc.. Would happily recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “So Friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: 52mat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights in July. From the moment we walked in the door, we felt welcomed. There was a smiling face at the desk when we left and when we returned. It was so homey!! I decided to travel without a computer but there was a computer in the lobby. The rooms were clean, and spacious for a European hotel. The location was awesome - quiet and convenient - close to several metro stations. And did I say how nice the staff was?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lenox”
Reviews.Author: kervatt
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lenox is in an ideal location on the left bank close to Musee d'Orsay. The rooms, although rather small as is typical, are nicely furnished and clean. The price is average for the area. The hotel staff who speak English are quite friendly and accommodating. I would recommend this hotel for the location.

Reviews.Title: “charming, cosy and affordable in a very desirable district”
Reviews.Author: CapeTownMargaret
Reviews.Content: A very affordable hotel in a charming Paris district . Clean and cosy rooms, kind, helpful but unobtrusive staff. Easy access to all Paris has to offer. I would love to stay here again on a return trip and would definitely recommend this hotel to travelling friends and colleagues. One minor quibble. It would have been nice to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Nonetheless this would be my first choice on a return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Established Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NigelUK2011
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel many times over the past few years, on business and pleasure. Great location in the heart of fashionable Saint Germain and friendly staff! The Jazz Bar and rooms have just been refurbished to a high standard, lot's of good restaurants and cafes nearby. We shall be returning to Paris in the spring and highly recommend the Hotel Lennox Saint Germain.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel in the best part of Paris - comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: english-and-proud-of
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to stay on the Left Bank among the bustle of cafes, galleries and the trendy life of the real heart of Paris, this place is it. I've been a number of times now in different seasons and every time it has been special. Despite being close to everything it's so quiet. The lounge is relaxing and the cosy bar has a New York retro-chic feel. The rooms are lovely - with clean, fresh and smart decor, and comfy beds. The staff have always been so welcoming and friendly which is lovely to find in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Boutique Hotel. Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: kgc12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lenox in August with a colleague when we were doing a buying trip across France. The hotel's location near the antique shops, cute cafes and the Louvre were definitely a plus for us. The rooms are a tad small, but that's Paris for you. They weren't at all uncomfortable though. I love the decor and the beds were very comfortable. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean as well. They serve a light breakfast downstairs daily with breads, cheeses, and yogurts and coffee. This was perfect for me since I usually eat a light breakfast. I think the Lenox is such a good value! I will be back in Paris next week, so I just booked the Lenox for another stay. I've stayed at many hotels in Paris, but this is the one I will always come back to!

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique hotel in a great area at a very, very good price!”
Reviews.Author: missasm
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lenox is a real treat in the heart of Paris. A small but very chic boutique hotel on a quite street in the buzzing area of St. Germain. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, the hotel bar lovely for an aperitif before heading out to the many fabulous restaurants in the area. Sightseeing highlights are often in walking distance (the Louvre is only 5 minutes walk away) or easy to reach by one of the many metro or train stations close by. We stayed in a standard room, which are incredibly good value for money. Although they may be quite small, the bed is very comfy and big and the room has all appliances you would expect. They even have free wifi and a communal computer in the foyer if you need to quickly check some information or emails. All in all, Hotel Lenox is a true gem in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: Heatherlavender
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was recommended by Sawdays Special Places to Stay. It was a bit tricky to find at first, but we received a warm welcome and when we asked for a recommendation for lunch, a booking was made on our behalf at the excellent Bistro de Paris. Our Deluxe Room was small, but better than others for the same price in Paris, though with not enough lighting. Otherwise, well arranged and very comfortable and the bathroom a decent size for Paris. Breakfast was perfect for us - a selection of tea, coffee, and a healthy selection of fruit juices, muesli and cereals, as well as stewed and fresh fruits, cold meats and boiled eggs. Also good value. We found all the staff to be helpful, friendly and interested and we would like to compliment them unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected..”
Reviews.Author: Scorpgirl212
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at this hotel for our honeymoon. We were referred here through a friend of ours. This was my first time in Paris so I didn't really know what to expect. The staff here was extremely nice and courteous to the both of us, especially Olivier. We stayed in a Deluxe Room on the fourth floor. The room was clean and bright. It had everything we were looking for. We have traveled to Italy and England before so we are use to the european sizes. The free WI-FI was a plus, we had brought our laptop with us to do research on tourist attractions and to keep in touch with our friends and family back home. Even if you don't bring a laptop the hotel has one in the lobby for their guests to use free of charge. This hotel had real character and it's in a quaint neighborhood. There are many art boutiques lining the street and it's located in a residential neighborhood. We felt safe to take our nightly stroll through the neighborhood. Also its ideally located near the metro. We walked to the Eiffel Tower and many places from our hotel, that way you could take in the sites and people. We would definitely stay at the Lenox in St. Germain when we come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox is a great value in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: auguste9
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Lenox twice, and had a flawless stay both times. The location is convenient for walking or to the metro. The rooms are European size, ie small, but have everything you need and are clean, quite, and comfortable. While we were there, we went to outstanding restaurants every night, which we had arranged ahead. We asked the staff to make calls to confirm all of our reservations, which they did without hesitation. The staff were always available and a great help. There is an advantage to staying in a relatively smaller hotel, because there are no crowds or lines. The Lenox also offers a breakfast service- the huge croissants, yogurt, coffee, and juice were plenty to get us ready for a full day of sightseeing. There is a computer in the lobby where you can check your email, or look up something on the internet. Some of the restaurants I recommend are: Bolfinger- a very large restaurant which is popular with the Parisiennes, and specializes in seafood, Le Reminet, a very small restaurant with wonderful food, and of course the historic Tour d'argent.. Other highlights of the trip were attending a ballet at the Opera House, and walking on Rue Mouffetard- one of many colorful market streets. Paris is beautiful as always. We are looking forward to our return, and plan to stay at the Lenox again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Toronto_10
Reviews.Content: The desk staff were extremely helpful, the rooms if somewhat small were clean and comfortable (who goes to Paris to hang in their room?). The Hotel was an easy walk to the major art galleries, restaurants, just a few minutes from the Seine. There is a small comfortable bar in the hotel, however we used it only for the continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TimelessInteriors
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent an enjoyable 8 nights at the hotel. The Deluxe room was quite spacious by Parisien standards with a closet to store clothing, a desk and free wi fi internet - great for business travellers and keeping in touch with family and friends. Recently refurbished, the rooms were tastefully decorated with lovely windows opening to the outdoors for some fresh air. Bright and clean, modern bathroom. Charming breakfast room with a lovely buffet of fresh food available if required. Friendly and attentive staff assisted with our enquiries and requests. Great location in the heart of St Germaine within easy walking distance of most of Paris's many attractions. Highly recommend this hotel. This is our 2nd visit and will stay there again next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal!”
Reviews.Author: croissantloverLondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Lenox four times over the last 6 years and it has been consistently excellent. I originally chose it because of its location - just along the road from my favourite road, the Rue Jacob, and just off the Boulevard St Germain. Its amazingly quiet considering its just off the main drag. The rooms are nicely decorated, the beds very comfortable, and the breakfast absolutely delicious - even the coffee! This is the only hotel I would consider staying at in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before you stay here...”
Reviews.Author: FlyGal25
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in the Lenox St. Germain. Upon an exicted arrival into Paris via the Eurostar, only to receive a lack luster welcome by hotel staff which did not inform us of any ammenities (ie, no mention of the hotel password for internet, or breakfast times in the morning.) And I cannot believe no one on here has mentioned the room keys! OMG, they are 1980's first generation electronic key with the holes in the card that you have to leave with the front desk everytime you exit the hotel! The key should have been my tip-off of what was to come. Room was dull, dull, dull. No pictures on the wall just a bed, two black laquered nightstands, teeny tiny desk & chair, and a bathroom with ZERO counter space. And this was a DELUXE room, not a standard. Also NO ALARM CLOCK!! Just a old phone from the 80's that had no indication of what number to dial the front desk with. Yes, European hotels are smaller and I understand that, but this was mega small. My walk in closet at home was the size of this room. After spending all day/night out and about, came back to our room (don't forget we had to stop at the front desk to ask for our key) to relax a little before bed. TV only had French stations working. Told we should have 4 English stations, but they don't know why we don't have them. No apology, just a shrug of the shoulders. We gave up on that and decided to just go to bed. Whew, it is getting warm in our cubby hole we need to turn on the air-conditioning....uh NOPE! Broken in our room. And everyone on tripadvisor mentions how this is on a quiet street. It's quiet if the windows are CLOSED. But if it is open to get air circulating then the street is loud with motorcyles zooming past, ladies heels clip clopping on the street, and people talking loudy as they walk by. And don't forget the wonderful cigarette smoke that lingers up. UGH! Morning time, can't wait to get out of this room. Let's start this day with a clean slate figuratively and literally -- but oh no the shower! No water pressure to the shower head, just a little trickle. Now I can't wash my hair. That is it, I'm fuming. Finish getting ready with dirty hair and calm myself down enough to be civil to the front desk. Inform them of all the problems (no a/c, no tv, no water pressure) and tell them I either need a new room or some type of reimbursement. These are the two things I do give credit to the Lenox St. Germain for: 1. They could not give us another room so they compensated us 50 Euros per night. I still think 160 Euros per night for that hotel is too much. It really is a 2 star hotel in my eye. 2. The bed was comfortable. Although we did not use the blanket, I highly doubt it would be handy since it was thin and had a rough texture. It would not be a cozy blanket by any means. All in all I would definitely say check out some other places before you book here. To put it in the most forward way, we hated every minute of this hotel. Did not like it at all!! No charm, no romance, just one large headache.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at the Lenox Hotel”
Reviews.Author: awstruck
Reviews.Content: We had fond memories of our last trip to Paris and this charming hotel and again the hotel met all our expectations. The hotel had free wi-fi and patient staff to help us with all our tourist questions. The hotel had a wonderful, white linen table cloth breakfast for a comprable price, and the bar connected to the hotel was a wonderful respite at the end of a long day . The staff went out of their way to make our visit easy and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lenox fantastique - Susie Jordan Partridge Lady Harford”
Reviews.Author: Susiejordanpartridge
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my colleague Madam Boisragen at the Lenox for the Pret A Porter Fashion Week at the Porte de Versailles. The hotel is situated in my favourite area of Paris on the Left Bank, accessible to the Metro and to Le Deux Margots, other excellent Brassieries and Restaurants and the many Boutiques and shops including the elegant Bon Marche store, The Hotel is exclusive, the rooms very comfortable with beds dressed in the finest white cotton, with all facilities including WiFi and Sky. The staff extremely competant and pleasant especially the daytime receptionists, Stephane, Denis and co.. The breakfast served at the touch of a bell, by a very amiable garcon who hops up a few flights of stairs in a jiffy with a warm croissant, butter and jam and a jug of hot coffee and milk. Would never stay anywhere else after this experience, preferable to Georges V, Crillon, Bristol all of which I have stayed in before, but so impersonal. Reasonably priced for the excellent service and exclusivity.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and quiet”
Reviews.Author: jcerra
Reviews.Content: Fresh flowers filled the air with a lovely scent as We arrived in the hotel's 'newly decorated lobby very early Saturday morning . We Received a warm welcome from staff and Stored o luggage at the hotel check -in time Until at 1:00 pm. Our room was very charming and quiet, and the Bed was Extremely comfortable. The Bathroom was bright and clean, and I was very happy to see a bathub with the shower . I loved the soap . The were lovely towels , There Are No goal face cloths , so bring your own if you want. There was glass elevator est aussi On The exterior of the hotel making it Easier to get luggage up to our room on the 4th floor. On Two Separate mornings of our stay , we Had a delicious and hearty continental breakfast of croissants, baguettes , yogurt , juice , and coffee in the hotel bar Dedicated to Louis Armstrong; wood inlay beautiful pictorial of the musician is Himself the bar walls. The staff were very pleasant and Accommodating , Helping with reservations for the Bateaux Mouches and The Lido. The hotel is Located Within Walking Distance Of Many fine shops , restaurants , and museums, but not too close to Be Bothered by noise at night . We Had a wonderful stay and we look forward to coming back to this hotel again Specifying .

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: antiques9
Reviews.Content: During our antique trips we always stay at one of Bertrand Plasmans' hotels. Stephane, Denis, Michelle, Terry make our stay relaxing and comfortable. When I enter the hotel, I feel like I am visting life long friends. My room is quite and comfortable, at a reasonable price. I feel at home and wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. Also, the location is great....walking distance to Metro, fabulous resturants, shopping, and museum.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice but beware of your room location!”
Reviews.Author: ctdianeCt
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, on a quiet street but a quick walk to restaurants, crossing the Seine to the Louvre and beyond, and in the St. Germain de Pres area without the noise and crowds. Above all, do NOT stay on the 5th/top floor that offers attic-style rooms. Despite the A/C, our room was stifling (we asked to move and were relocated to the 3rd floor); baths on the 5th floor are too small and the hairdryer is nearly useless. In the summer heat, I would urge a traveler to seek a hotel with more modern a/c. The desk staff were very accommodating and courteous. The bar/lounge was a great haven after a long, hot day. The lobby was roomy and well appointed. We might stay there again, but not in the summer season.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right, Fantastic Location... but lacking that certain je ne se coix”
Reviews.Author: holidayhero10
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Lenox St Germain for two nights. Overall I would reccommend this hotel if you are not too fussed about the little details. Had they done things better I think they could have 4 stars but at the moment i would rate this hotel to have JUST at the lower end of 3 stars.(its not a negative comment, just realistic) My room was on the first floor (no16) and for a single traveler the size was fine (if we were 2 people i think it would be too small) I wouldve liked to be upgraded, I actually mentioned that perhaps i will see the other rooms but the concierge said that I have a very nice room (mmmm... ok lets see about that- alas i took his word for it, and now i'm wondering if perhaps I shouldve paid more and upgraded only because it wasn't as special as in the reviews, or on the pictures) I'm going to warn you that i'm quite a fussy person and i've stayed in numerous hotels and paying 130Euro per night for the classic room I would expect just a bit more. 1.) i understand the hotel has recently been renovated, well, I can tell that my room had new curtains, and a head board etc, but the doors and half of room being painted in chocolate brown definately didn't do it justice, plus it had an awful light brown throw over the bed (30C Paris) very artificial woollen thing i had to get rid of immediately 2) the bathroom wasn't renovated apart from a few new fixtures such as mirror but the tiles shouldve been changed as grouting was dirty, and they kept the old loo seat etc... just a bit dissapointing to be honest. The showerhead was attached to a cord that is too small so 50% of the water gushed through the top of that instead of through the showerhead. (There is a bath, but honestly i'm not sure that any adult would be able to fit in it as it is so small - these are all things that should be addressed during a renovation and they couldve then decided to install a shower instead!) 3) they had nice bedsheets and towels however i was under the impression that I will have a queen bed,what i got were two single beds pushed together, which left me unable to lie in the middle of the bed :-( (which is the pleasure of being a solo traveller paying for a queen bed and being able to stretch out, still the bed was comfortable and after a long day perfect!) 4)I was unable to open half of the cupboard as it was blocked by one of the bedside tables (i understand that there is nowhere else to put this cupboard, and it was a good size so not going to complain too much about this, however then placing the safe on the wrong side so that i'm now also unable to reach the safe or open the safe door fully due to it being placed on the wrong side of the cupboard (just attention to detail that is lacking) 5) there is no full length mirror...;-( as a lady i can't see how my outfit looks 6) the brown stripe carpets make it difficult to see if it might be dirty, and they were not particularly soft so decorwise it made the room very dark, and not the most welcoming. 7) I walked past other 3 star hotels and the curb appeal was much nicer, fyi, i'm not sure Hotel Lenox realised that their trees out front are half dead... perhaps they need to inspect, compared to other 3 stars who had beautifully manicured trees and lighting outside. PLUS POINTS!!!! 1)free wireless 2)lounge at entrance is lovely, nice music and magazines and beautifully decorated 3)the bar was closed and it wouldve been nice if i was told about this prior to my booking as it supposedly has live music, and it does look lovely on the inside, just the place you want to relax after a night out and walking in at 2 am for a nightcap. 4)Location location location, its a 3 minute walk to the seine, 8 minutes to the middle of the louvre, 2 minutes to the nearest Laduree, and surrounded by galleries and restaurants etc (howerver be warned that everything is closed during August (parisan holidays) and everything shut on Sundays.. ;-( 5)staff speak english and were helpful as i left my international plug at home... very good service (but perhaps couldve been a bit more by for instance asking if i'd like a coffee or a drink when i walked in late one night and sat in the lounge checking my emails... (just again coming from someone who is perhaps used to it?) 6)they were happy to keep my bags whilst i scoured the city after my checkout Conclusion: Should you stay here? YES, Would i stay here again... No Who is it for..... people who don't mind paying over 100Euro and are not particularly worried about detail and decor... as everything was to a good standard... but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly and accomodating staff, very clean and modern.”
Reviews.Author: parislove_10
Reviews.Content: I took my teenage daughter on a mother-daughter trip to Paris and we loved the hotel. The location could not have been better for us. From this point you can walk almost anywhere in the central city. The neighnorhood is residential and quiet with lovely architecture. It's close to many museums and one of the best bakeries in the city, Eric Kaiser. The neighborhood felt very safe for walking at night. The only downside is that, like many hotels in Paris, the walls are thin so sound travels between rooms, depending where you are in the hotel. The hotel was very accommodating and successfully handled this issue.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Lenox was one of the reasons our stay in Paris was memorable”
Reviews.Author: swan3025
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Hotel Lenox was great; from the location (accessible to cafes, museums, shopping, etc.) to the staff. The front desk personnel, especially Denis, were always pleasant, helpful and responsive to our every need or request. Their knowledge of the city was invaluable as we wanted to experience many venues. My daughter and I enjoyed that our room overlooked the rue de l'universite, and construction was not a problem. Although the room was a bit small, (larger rooms are available) it was quaint, had the necessary amenities, and most importantly..was always clean. The bed was quite comfortable. At the end of our day, it was a pleasure to return to the Hotel Lenox to relax in the lounge with other guests or to unwind in our room. BTW, the hotel is but a few minutes walk to the Seine...marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back! Great Hotel in a perfect location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: p_legg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for just 1 night en route to Germany after an extended holiday in the South East of France. The location of the hotel is great, and the decor and furnishings stylish and classy. We felt that it was excellent value for money, and while I have read other comments about the rooms being very small, we did not agree. Perhaps the travellers were large?

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Saint Germain des Prés Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndySRJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our granddaughter to Paris as a high school graduation gift and stayed at the Hotel Lenox for 5 nights. We were very much impressed with the hotel and service. The hotel has been recently renovated and it was clean and cheerful. Furthermore, the gentlemen at the desk were very helpful with making (multiple) dinner reservations, calling for cabs, and anything else we needed. Most importantly, they spoke excellent English and were most cordial. We had a large loft room that was large enough for the three of us. It was quite warm in Paris during our trip but the air conditioning in the room was excellent and in any case it was cool at night. The hotel is located within a few blocks of 3 metro or train stops, all and all a great location. it is also noteworthy that we were able to communicate via e-mail before our trip to make appropriate room reservations and even some dinner reservations (in English).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel! Would really reccommend it.”
Reviews.Author: JandSManchester
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Lenox in June 2010. I travelled with my partner. We both loved the hotel. The staff were super friendly and the service great. The hotel decor was lovely and very clean. The location was superb. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling a little ripped off and uncharmed”
Reviews.Author: KGrayUK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel as we are usually happy with Sawday's recommendations. At £140 per night, I expect a room large enough to walk past the other occupant without tripping, but this was not possible. We live in London and understand small spaces, but this was ridiculous. The bed was too hard, construction next door, the lift noise very audible in our room and not the greatest service. When we ask to have a lightbulb which had burned out replaced, they had to do it the next day as none were kept in the hotel. So one sleepless night with no bedside lamp to read by. The location is great, but do not book the "classic" room, as it is not good value and generally uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation in need of Supervision”
Reviews.Author: RemyInFrance
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location--The very best. However, cleanliness and service are serious deficiencies: 1) no bar of soap; no pillow cases for extra pillows; armoire showed fingerprints in powder for duration of visit, even after reporting same; 2) could not close door to room 42 without slamming it shut and disturbing other guests; 3) room 44 entry so narrow that suitcase could not be maneuvered inside without moving furniture! Promised bottle of Sancerre after becoming fan of hotel on Facebook was: (i) initially two glasses of wine charged to the room; once charge was removed, desk said (ii) internet rate did not have a right to "half-bottle" of Sancerre--(iii)after producing email from hotel about promised bottle of Sancerre, desk said email didn't come from the same agency that handles reservations. After protesting (over two day period) that the Lenox should honor its written commitment, desk manager then asked for proof that guest was a fan on Facebook--staff arrogant and condescending. What a disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “A comforable, recently-renovated Hotel in a very convenient (and quiet) location”
Reviews.Author: ReTurner323617
Reviews.Content: The Hotel provided a pleasant stay for our 3-night trip to Paris. The front-desk staff were very helpful, and the room has good-sized and clean. The vaulted basement breakfast room was nicely equipped and the buffet breakfast nicely presented. The bar is a classic. The only cons were a little bit of noise transference between rooms (this is not uncommon), and the housekeeping staff could have been a bit more attentive and proactive; but neither of these should cause significant concern... Overall the stay was very positive and I would both return to and recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, stylish, amazing central location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: AdamAndJoanna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and we weren't let down. The location is superb: right in the middle of St Germain district close to all the nightlife and the river - the Louvre is a fairly short walk away. There are also numerous coffee and sandwich shops nearby. Brilliantly, the hotel is on a residential street, so is quieter than most Paris streets. The room we stayed in was very small, but it was well laid out and spotless. The ensuite shower room was also spotless, with good water pressure. The air conditioning worked a treat, and the wi-fi connection was fast. To use the wi-fi you need to ask for a login code from reception. The reception staff speak good English, useful for those like us whos French isn't up to scratch! Next time we visit Paris we will definitely come back here, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: drtckelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our first trip to Paris. The location was great--close enough to the St Germain des Pres metro stop but far enough away from the craziness and noise. The staff were knowledgeable and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff; great location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: CDevlin
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the Rive Gauche, the hotel is nevertheless on a quiet street, which means you don't have to sacrifice your sleep to be a few minutes walk away from the Seine and great restaurants, galleries, the metro, etc. I came on business so didn't have a lot of time to explore, but Denis on staff was a fantastic host and pointed me to the best places, including the chic Rosa Bonheur that even my friends who live in Paris didn't know about. The room was clean, functional, and practical, which was all I needed--also had free wi-fi! All at a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Denis was a big hit!”
Reviews.Author: LAVenetians
Reviews.Content: Denis, at the front desk, was funny, helpful and gracious. If you stay at the Hotel Lenox be sure to ask for him. I looked forward to seeing him each day and he made our trip more enjoyable. The Los Angeles Venetians

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MollyBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the Lenox, 3rd floor, Rm. 35. The room had A/C, but also two large windows, which could be opened onto rue l'Universite; no street noise noticeable. Modern, marble bath with shower in tub, but lack of shelf space in bathroom, and no plug in b.r. were slight drawbacks (hair dryer on wall). The room had shelves in the closet for storage, and also a safe. A desk in the room, provided table space. The staff is superb, three informative guys took turns manning the desk. They couldn't be more helpful. Hotel has been updated, and the outside was being painted on our arrival. Buffet (14.00 Euros) or Continental breakfast (11 Euros) is available. There's a small bar/lounge with classy decor, for evening drinks. Great location; very clean rooms, excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Lenox had everything we needed and wanted, friendly helpful desk staff, charm, location being at the top of the list”
Reviews.Author: CCSConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Recommended by a friend the Lenox was all she promised. It is beautiful and charming, being both old-worldly in decor but modern and comfortable in the room and bathroom. The location is perfect for all sightseeing and there are many cafes nearby. The front desk staff, especially Stephane and Dennis, could not have been more friendly or helpful. They truly made us feel at home and welcomed us each time we came in and out. We would love to stay there again and will certainly pass along our recommendations to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: hanswurscht
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly & helpful staff, cozy rooms! I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel in the heart of the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: dwaterman
Reviews.Content: I will preface this by saying I have little to compare to in Paris, but we really enjoyed our stay here. The good: Staff was incredibly friendly, helpful, and tried to speak english as best as they could. Rooms were clean, bathroom and shower almost full size, great lobby. The bad: Rooms were very small (put this in my preface that I have little to compare it to in Paris.) I am pretty sure this is how it goes in Paris, and if so, then I would not put this in a bad category. We had two days of heat that made A/C essential. After numerous complaints, they finally turned the A/C on. This was the best day on our trip! We came home after heat exhaustion and the running A/C was amazing! Seriously, this is a great place and I commend them on their loveliness. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. 3 to 4 blocks from the Seine, the D'Orsay, The Louvre. Eric Kayser Boulangerie around the corner, Creperies, Frommageries, just an amazing place to be!!

Reviews.Title: “Reception was warm and welcoming, most helpful and informative.”
Reviews.Content: The hotel was positioned well one block from the Seine and the Louve on the other side of the river. The Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame also walking distance, and the metro and RER close for those times when the feet had had enough. Having said that, the neighbourhood was quiet and personal and away from the crowds, yet minutes from everything. With little bakeries, cheese shops and small grocery stores near by it makes for a nice environment. Galleries and beautifully decorated little boutiques and home stores, it make for great window shopping. My room was air conditioned which is a plus when you close the double glazed windows at night for quiet sleep, without the room getting too warm. The bathroom was a good size as was my room. Arrived in from a 36 hour trip and ordered room service which was prompt and smelt amazing. Free internet access on hotel computer in the lobby was a bonus for me as didn't have my laptop with me. Denis, the receptionist had a relaxed style with a sense of fun, I did not feel uncomfortable asking questions or directions etc. I found this hotel suitable for the short stay that I had there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for the money/location”
Reviews.Author: StaniMesh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Paris for the first time; and prior to booking, she did her research on hundreds of hotels, reading reviews for each. We settled on Hotel Lenox because of the location and value, and the reviews were positive. We weren't dissapointed, the place was PERFECT! They are just completing some renovation, but nothing that took away from the hotel. We booked a deluxe room to have some more space (keep in mind European hotels are smaller because they are in older buildings). Worth the extra Euro, and it was still a great value compared to other hotels in the area. This is in the heart of the Saint Germaine-Peres area, which has great shopping, great restaurants, and is central to all of the main sights; close to the boat to get to other points. Louvre is just across the river, Notre Dame a short walk, etc. The staff was VERY friendly, breakfast each morning was very good, and again the staff made sure there was plenty right up until 11am when they stop serving. The walls are a little thin, so at night we could hear doors close, etc but nothing horrible. If you leave the windows open there will be some street noise, but suprisingly, closing the windows cancelled it out. All in all, perfect location, perfect service, great value. It's a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Service could be better great location”
Reviews.Author: patmor01
Reviews.Content: We had a great trip in Paris but beware of the room and service this hotel provide. The standard room are sometime roomier than there superior room. The staff was helpful but everytime we asked for something they look annoyed.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Lenox Saint Germain
HotelInfo.Address: 9 rue de l'universite | 7th Arr., 75007 Paris, France
